def: The investigation of the relation between the sun, moon, andstars, and the weather.-- As`*tro*me`te*or`o*log"ic*al, a.-- As`tro*me`te*or*ol"o*gist, n.
A woman who manages a boat.

The theme or subject; a leading phrase or passage which isreproduced and varied through the course of a comor a movement; ashort figure, or melodic germ, out of which a whole movement isdevelpoed. See also Leading motive, under Leading. [Written alsomotivo.]
In the manner or condition of a mulier; in wedlock;legitimately. [Obs.]
Variant of Felon. [Obs.]Those two were foes the fellonest on ground. Spenser.
A Central American name for the ivory nut.
